page.title: 03HOUSING IN PERTH
page.content: Victorian housing spread along the roads and railways. The villas of the Glasgow Road are privately owned and often used as guest houses.In contrast, tenements by the railway and near city centre industry are some of the least attractive housing in Perth. 31% have no hot water, 59% have no fixed bath and 45% no inside lavatory. A deprived area is a facet of every town and Perth is no exception. Hunter Crescent is such an area. Once sound, these council houses have deteriorated due to neglect and misuse and now the area has earned itself an unfavourable reputation as a sanctuary for drug addicts and glue sniffers. Amenities there are nil, living conditions are poor, dogs run free, and windows boarded up with wood or corrugated iron are all too common. Attempts to improve the area are being made.
